go.code: // exponentiation.go // description: Implementation of Modular Exponentiation Algorithm // details: // A simple implementation of Modular Exponentiation - [Modular Exponenetation wiki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modular_exponentiation) // author(s) [Taj](https://github.com/tjgurwara99) // see exponentiation_test.go package modular import ( "errors" "math" ) // ErrorIntOverflow For asserting that the values do not overflow in Int64 var ErrorIntOverflow = errors.New("integer overflow") // ErrorNegativeExponent for asserting that the exponent we receive is positive var ErrorNegativeExponent = errors.New("negative Exponent provided") // Exponentiation returns base^exponent % mod func Exponentiation(base, exponent, mod int64) (int64, error) { if mod == 1 { return 0, nil } if exponent < 0 { return -1, ErrorNegativeExponent } _, err := Multiply64BitInt(mod-1, mod-1) if err != nil { return -1, err } var result int64 = 1 base = base % mod for exponent > 0 { if exponent%2 == 1 { result = (result * base) % mod } exponent = exponent >> 1 base = (base * base) % mod } return result, nil } // Multiply64BitInt Checking if the integer multiplication overflows func Multiply64BitInt(left, right int64) (int64, error) { if math.Abs(float64(left)) > float64(math.MaxInt64)/math.Abs(float64(right)) { return 0, ErrorIntOverflow } return left * right, nil }
